answerText: Capacitor[10] These surfaces along which the gradient of the Electric Field is zero, are always perpendicular to the Electric field lines. The plates of a capacitor are these surfaces with delta V =0.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 6 | 4 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: An early example of these devices consisted of a glass jar on which 2 metal plates were placed and which was often filled with water, the Leyden jar. For 10 points each:   [10] Name these devices, which store charge between two parallel plates. Their namesake quantity, which is measured in Farads, is the ratio between the stored charge and the Voltage.
